name: pendency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the time when something is pending (= waiting to happen), especially a legal or official process, or the state of being pending: during the pendency of He will be held in jail during the pendency of (= while waiting for) the trial. Very few people actually reconcile during the pendency of a divorce.
More examplesFewer examplesDuring the pendency of this dispute, we are paying the rent proposed.The family's lawyers asked for assurance that the child would not be removed during the pendency of the case. Long pendency is not the only issue that affects expectations in the courts.
